name: Cajun Shrimp and Andouille Nachos
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: Cajun-seasoned shrimp, andouille, and the trinity piled high on chips and smothered in melty cheese for nachos you won't soon forget!
ingredients: 12 ounces raw peeled and deveined shrimp
2 teaspoons seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
1 (8 ounce) package shredded Colby Jack cheese
directions: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat
Add andouille and cook for 2 minutes
Add onion and cook for 2 minutes more
Add bell peppers and cook for 2 minutes more
Remove from heat and stir in celery
Line a baking sheet with foil and place tortilla chips on top
Cover chips with the sausage mixture
Place shrimp in a bowl; add oil and seafood seasoning
Place shrimp in the same skillet and cook over medium-high heat for 3 minutes
Scatter shrimp on top of the sausage mixture
Sprinkle Colby Jack cheese over the nachos
Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler to low
Broil nachos until cheese has melted, about 3 minutes
